intro: Verbascum bulbosum, commonly known as the bulbous mullein, is a perennial plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems that can reach up to 2 meters in height, bearing large, gray-green leaves with a fuzzy texture. The plant produces showy yellow flowers in late spring to early summer, which are clustered in dense, terminal spikes. It thrives in dry, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Verbascum bulbosum is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally for its soothing effects on respiratory conditions.
